Encinitas is a small beach town in the

. The town has a main street that looks to be right out of a George Lucas 1950's movie scene, including a city name sign spanning the Coast Highway that welcomes visitors arriving into the north end of town from

. Population of Encinitas is around 50,000.

Visitor info can be found at 138 Encinitas Blvd.
Encinitas is located just off Interstate Highway 5. Take the Encinitas Blvd exit.

rail line between San Diego and Oceanside stops in Encinitas. The station is located downtown between C and D streets. Starting on a date announced by Amtrak, 6 (3 Northbound, 3 Southbound) Pacific Surfliner trains will stop here daily.

Long-distance trains are also provided by
The closest international airport is in
(SAN), and the closest commercial airport is the McClellan-Palomar Airport in
International Airport (LAX) is 2-3 hours by bus or car depending on traffic.
Almost everything can be reached by foot, including the beach and most restaurants and shopping.
also offers buses and trains for transportation purposes.

value: . Main entrance to the seemingly endless stretch of the sandy beach is at C street. A scenic outlook and stair access can also be found at the end of D street. Swimming is allowed only in designated areas.

content=Specializing in tropical rainforest plants with the largest display of bamboo in the world.  A great way to spend the day gazing at magnificent and exotic plants, it's also a popular wedding destination.
name=Meditation Gardens at the Self Realization Fellowship

a favorite activity in Encinitas. Swami's is one of the most famous surf spots in Southern California, which is accessed via steep stairs down the bluff from the small city park by the same name at the south end of town. Several surf shops along Coast Highway can provide gear for the visitor.

content=Oceanfront camping with beautiful views. Surfing and swimming beaches within short walking distance. Reservations can be made in advance, but the park books up for the peak summer season very early in the year.
content=For those who want to try out surfing for the first time with year around 2 hour surf lessons and summer surf camps.
.  Beautiful white sand beach at the north end of town. West end of 'B' Street. Lifeguards on duty in season.
content=One of the first and still one of the best skate parks in the world.  Not uncommon to see greats such as Tony Hawk here.
content=Clothes, swim suits, surfboards, and almost all beach needs can be purchased  here located at the south end of the 101

content=Amazing local used music store. Plenty of new/used vinyl to choose from.
Lots of great cameras and film.

Encinitas is a small town with a long restaurant list. Along Coast Highway 101's downtown district are a wide range of options from upscale Italian to cozy cafes and diners. Small cafes can be found in the more residential streets heading towards the beach.

value: content=A local favorite, built inside the 1888 Santa Fe Railroad Station. Lots of places to hangout both inside and out. Very casual atmosphere.
content=Baked goods and lunch specials. Live music, internet and wireless (with purchase).
content=Popular breakfast and lunch cafe with plenty of California and Mexican favorites.
content=Meat, seafood and vegetarian dishes in a casual atmosphere. Don't miss the specials listed on the table.

content=An Italian restaurant with a Tuscan style menu, and food prepared using fresh ingredients. There is a beautiful outdoor dining area with a water fountain. The food is quite excellent and if you are planning do be sure to make reservations.
content=In the Lumberyard. Gelato and sandwiches.
content=A popular inexpensive Mexican food shop. Big burritos.
content=Just across the street from the Self-Realization Fellowship. Get there early, because it can be nearly full at noon on weekends. Try their awesome beer.
content=Another popular inexpensive Mexican food shop located across the street from La Paloma Theatre. Especially good when the old lady is cooking inside. Try their tacos.
, A cafe selling Açai Smoothies, Açai Bowls, and much more (Açai is a palm that grows in the Amazon, producing Açai berries that are used in many recipes).

content=Free continental breakfast, free wifi, spa, etc. Walking distance to beach.

Driving North on PCH will get you into Carlsbad, and driving south will set you in Solana Beach. Inland of Carlsbad is La Costa, and inland of Solana Beach is Rancho Santa Fe.
